name: Missouri State Penitentiary
address: 115 Lafayette St, Jefferson City, MO 65101, USA
reviews: Nine friends and I booked a 5-hour photography tour. I knew it was going to be cool but it exceeded all of my expectations. Our guide, Larry, actually used to work at the facility and share so many personal stories with us. There were certain areas that had some tornado damage so we were unable to tour then but even then we didn’t run out of locations in the five hours. Our guide was also patient with us photographing high and low every 3 feet too. If you enjoy history of a different kind and abandoned places it will be an exceptional visit for you too.

Awesome tour, tour guides are previous guards, warden. They have first hand knowledge of this place. Too scared to do the overnight ghost tour, so I went during the day. It was even a little scary during daylight. Very cool place, and prices very reasonable to tour.

Tour was very informative about the history of this facility.  You have the opportunity to see where the inmates lived and about some well known people who resided there. There is a lot of walking so where comfortable shoes.

We took the two hour tour (cold and damp in November so bring a hat and dress warmly) led by a former employee of many years. He had also studied well and knew so many interesting facts. This place is absolutely fascinating and huge. From his descriptions, I could totally imagine what it would have been like to be there back in the day. Great job.
Larry and Kathy were great Tour guides! Very informative and entertaining!  Had a great time.

name: Missouri State Capitol
address: 201 W Capitol Ave, Jefferson City, MO 65101, USA
reviews: Jefferson City has a nice downtown area mixing historic and modern buildings. The state capitol is worth a visit, not necessarily as a destination stop, but certainly for an hour or two break if you're passing through; or, as we did, make Jefferson City a stop for the night when traveling I-70 (it's only about 30 miles south of Columbia). Our highlights are the Thomas Hart Benton paintings in the House Lounge and several of the lunettes on the second floor (the tour guide pointed out the best ones). We also enjoyed exhibits on Missouri natural history.

I would definitely recommend taking a tour of the capital of the state of Missouri great art structures to be seen great place to take photographs lots of local venues Restaurant shopping in Jefferson City can make it worth the trip depending where you live Grounds of the capital or beautifully kept I recommend fall of the year early spring after they implanted all the flowers. A great One day road trip for residence and a beautiful place to stop for anyone passing through the state.
Even though had a 2 year old with our group it was interesting I also think that she was the youngest to visit the Capitol
Very pretty building, even if construction prevents you from seeing the outside.
Historical Art Work and Artifacts inside our beautiful Capitol. (Under construction 2020 currently in March).

name: Jefferson Landing State Historic Site
address: 100 Jefferson St, Jefferson City, MO 65101, USA
reviews: Great historic site. The decor, enviroment and overall feel of this place was spot on. My children and I loved it. Entertaining and educational. The staff were very helpful and knowledgeable. Overall very family friendly and a great experience!

Such history! The volunteers who wait patiently for adventurers to wander inside spring to life and share their knowledge and love of Missouri history in interesting ways. It’s really a great little piece of history in Jeff City.
Sweet Chipotle BBQ at the landing. With wooden Shafers. Brisket and pork was amazing.
Best place for homecoming pictures...👍
Wonderful history here. Flat Stanley agreed.

name: Museum of Missouri Military History
address: 2405 Logistics Rd, Jefferson City, MO 65101, USA
reviews:
It's all very well done. Interesting items everywhere you turn and the curators had answers for just about every question. 
In all fairness, I brought a group a elementary school students to the museum. :)

Plenty of historical mementos of past and future Missourians in the military who have contributed and some laid their lives for the nation.  Small museum but very nicely laid out with nice displays inside and outside of the museum.  Come and check it out!
Great displays and enjoyed being able to see the planes and equipment up close.
It was so awesome to see the historic pictures and the planes jets and equipment !
A wonderful museum to visit with so many displays and information on how Missourians have  participated in US military conflicts over the last 160 years. A MUST see for your family

name: Lewis and Clark Monument
address: 101 W Capitol Ave, Jefferson City, MO 65101, USA
reviews: Under construction but really nice area. Weather was perfect so added to the scenery.
Few things that relaxes me.  Is nature.  Totally amazing.
Much hard work went in to making this monument a huge success, job well done Janet M and crew. Hopefully we can get the entire country to stop and enjoy the history....
This was a fun and interesting monument to visit. And FREE!!!
Nice quiet place for a stop & a bit of history.

name: Binder Park
address: 5840 Rainbow Dr, Jefferson City, MO 65109, USA
reviews: Cool, well marked bike trails through the woods.  Different levels of riding, good for kids and adults.  A lot of spider webs in the early morning though!
It was really nice to get out with my 🐕 and he enjoyed it . Lots of people out enjoying weather and the Lake 🌞
Beautiful day at the park to do some geocaching.  Unfortunately, we couldn't find 2 of the 6 we looked for, nor had others so they probably need to be serviced but there are tons there!

Nice size lake, great for fishing, hosts a renaissance festival in August I think, good nature trails but must watch little ones as they could easily fall into the lake, not for elderly who need cane or walker (the trails, that is, they are not paved, lots of roots and rocks sticking up),  nice pavilion for get-togethers, floating dock to fish from, very pretty, camping area
Come play disc golf! Two 18 hole courses that are fair challenging. All kinds of space and woods for walks or runs, or enjoy fishing or relaxing by the water. 150 acre impoundedment.

name: Jefferson City Memorial Park
address: 111 Memorial Park Dr, Jefferson City, MO 65109, USA
reviews: This is a nice park. They have a great walking path and plenty of covered picnic tables. The play ground area has the padded floor and there is a basketball court as well as a pavilion that can be rented.
Good path/sidewalk around the perimeter, pavilion with kitchen, restrooms and mini/pavilions with one table and grill each. Lots of foilage, two playgrounds. Something for everyone here.

It's a nice park Well kept & seems to be safe.Its a nice place to walk(with or w/o a dog) & also includes a nice play area for kids.The shelter can accommodate a fairly large crowd for get togethers as well.

The kids had so much fun at this park! It is so beautiful! I wish our city had something this big and spaced out. There are a few playgrounds, a nice walking trail, lots of places for several families to BBQ. It is really a nice park! Towards the back of the park, there is a water park with huge slides! Jefferson City you truly are blessed!
Very nice, clean park. Nice playground and a nice place to go on a walk.

name: Ellis-Porter Park
address: 1425 Riverside Dr, Jefferson City, MO 65101, USA
reviews: Really nice park. Has swimming pool, basketball court, and playground. Had a nice view of the river as well.
Good experience of Amphitheatre movies
Perfect little park close to my daughter's school. The pool is nice with a good area for younger children. Also a nice little walking path.
Lots of space, multiple play grounds and pool in the summer
A nice view of the river, clean bathrooms, clean grounds, a working water fountain, and awesome pool, and amphitheatre.

name: McKay Park
address: 1700 Southridge Dr, Jefferson City, MO 65109, USA
reviews: Always a treat to visit McKay Park.  It is a wonderful natural setting with the most user friendly features.  The paved walk trail around the lake always has people of all ages walking/jogging through the pleasant scenery.  An updated large playground always has the giggles and laughter of children playing.  Today a unique surprise as a RC control operator was flying his "seaplane" on the glassy afternoon lake surface....and finally my main pursuit of happiness there today was the call of the Lake's most recently stocked Rainbow Trout...and my call was answered many times over catching and releasing several of these beauties.  Describing this experience as a "little bit of heaven on earth" might be a bit of a stretch...but after I left today I felt again that it is....!   Highly recommended.😍😍😍

The playground in this park is first rate, with a structure for little kids and another bigger structure for older kids. The bigger structure is tall, almost two stories. There are several different climbing options, and two slides in the bigger structure. Plus there are a couple of sets of swings. The lake is at least an acre. The sidewalks and lawn are nice all around the lake.
Trout fishing, dog walking, kids playground, 3 parking areas. There is a nice picnic area by the "lake" or rather pond and down the hill nice area to play soccer or other lawn sports.
Today was a very nice day and much needed fresh air. My nephews definitely enjoyed themselves.
Always a nice place to walk our dog. Just have to steer clear of droppings on the path left by the resident geese. 😊

name: Clark's Hill/ Norton State Historic Site
address: 8838, 1816 Osage Hickory St, Jefferson City, MO 65101, USA
reviews: An historic walking trail, with signs denoting the Lewis and Clark history abounding! There are several burial mounds located on the crest of the hills, with markers explaining their significance and history. The end of the trail features a gorgeous deck overlooking a large bluff, with miles of forest below. A definite must for anyone looking for an invigorating hike with a fantastic view if history!
It was a nice quiet hike. Kinda cold for January but I don't believe that you could see awesome veiw during spring or summer. I'm glad that no one has trashed it out yet
Beautiful trail with an amazing reward at the end, minus the 5ft black snake curled up sun bathing on the trail.
Way off the beaten path! A fantastic Central Missouri historical trail
Pretty cool place, but very secluded. At the end of the trail is a lookout that faces east. The trail is fairly easy to walk and there are a few decent views of the MO River.

name: North Jefferson City Recreation Area
address: 927 4th St, Jefferson City, MO 65101, USA
reviews: It was nice. I liked that the water fountain at the pavilion also had a spout to fill water bottles. The playground appeared to be well kept.
Great area with lots of functional space and buildings. Easy to find and navigate. Well run festival for the Solar Eclipse in 2017.
Great place for sporting events and hanging out with your family
Nicely separated rooms, well kept, and easily accessible
The park is pretty small, but I heard no complaints from my kids: 7, 5, and 2. The older ones made it an obstacle course and the 2 year old did swings.

name: Hough Park
address: Ivan Rd, Jefferson City, MO 65101, USA
reviews: Waitress was really attentive, clean tables. I just didn't care for my main course. Have eaten there before and liked it.

I love this place. I'll try to go here a few times a week. I fish here alone. Sometimes my kids will come with me, but not very often. Just a nice peaceful Park that feels like it gets you out of the city even though it's right in town.
It deserves 4 stars but I was shocked how nice the course  was it has a really cool layout and the green are solid so I gave it 5 stars I m going to play today
This golf course is in much better shape then I remember 10 years ago. For a public course, you can't beat the price and track. Greens run great.
Great local spot tucked away in between the rear of a golf course and a family friendly subdivision

name: McClung Park
address: 931 McClung Park Dr, Jefferson City, MO 65101, USA
reviews: My littlest one (almost 2yo) has a bit of trouble navigating some of the obstacles in this playground.  But the older kids enjoy it.  We found on our last trip there's an area with a large long table that could be great for crafting, and a large fire pit.  Requires permit to use, however.
Scenic little park.  Good view of Capitol rotunda and surrounding city.  Wooded trail and newer child playground with padded flooring.

I had never been here until last week for a friends wedding and it was perfect. The park has lots of space for activities and hosting a weddings. The pavillion is large and there was a serving area below the pavilion that couldn't be better!
Been to to events using the main event hall and it is great. Play grounds to send the kids to play and always clean.

Spacious,family friendly play ground and parking is plentiful. Kitchen, rest rooms and chairs if you need them. Located across Lincoln's Stadium ...BUT there is a huge curved hill at the entrance of the park.

name: Jefferson City Museum of Modern Art
address: 220 E High St a, Jefferson City, MO 65101, USA
reviews: If you have any interest in your own culture or that of others, or would like a more in depth view of some of the struggles and hardships that helped shape today's America, this place is a must stop and see on your next venture.   You can call and schedule free private tours for groups of any size. Chris, our tour guide, was very sweet and insightful as she educated us (me, husband, and 3 kids age 3, 10 & 13) on the featured artists and the message they portray in their work.
Very cool place. Currently have to have an appointment to get in, but well worth it.
A small but very nice.
Lots of history here..

name: Cole County Historical Museum
address: 109 Madison St, Jefferson City, MO 65101, USA
reviews: Great docents and many things to see.
Wonderful artifacts and knowledgeable toyrguudes.
Great museum and guided tour. Our guide was very knowledgeable. Loved it!
Beautiful area to stop and take pics
Small but interesting

name: Jefferson Landing Historic
address: 100 Jefferson St, Jefferson City, MO 65101, USA
reviews: Kind and helpful staff.
Very informative and I learned a lot from there.
Fountain of Centaurs was operating. Very nice area between state capital and railroad.  Area was clean and no riff raff
The museum is cool, but there isn't a whole lot to see.
Great to gaze over the Missouri river.

name: National Churchill Museum
address: 501 Westminster Ave, Fulton, MO 65251, USA
reviews: I loved the way this museum is setup at the church. A lot of resources have been dedicated to this speech and I'm glad to see it. It's impressive that the entire church was able to be imported all the way from London. Only suggestion I would have is that I'd like to see the gym where the speech was held tied into the museum a little bit more. Everything else was great. Thanks.
History at it's finest. Standing wgere Churchill did in front of a piece of the Berlin wall amazing.

A great day trip from the Kansas City area. So much amazing and interesting history in Fulton!
The museum below the church provides so much information. It was very well done.
The church is magnificent and the story of how it came to Fulton is anything but boring.
The art created by Churchill's granddaughter from 8 sections of the Berlin Wall is moving and a beautiful way for her to honor her grandfather.

We have been to the Imperial War Museum and Churchill War Rooms museum in London.. We drove through Fulton just to see this museum, too.. I didn't know what to expect but we were VERY impressed!! One of the better museums we have visited, well done and informative.  If you are remotely interested in Churchill - highly recommended!

The Winston Churchill Museum was very informative. This Museum was executed very tastefully. The artifacts were organized & original. I would recommend 2 to 3 hours for touring. Please take your family's to view, it was outstanding...

name: Rock Bridge Memorial State Park
address: 5901 South Highway 163, Columbia, MO 65203, USA
reviews:
I love hiking here. Just a cool piece of Missouri history. Allegedly? The Devils Ice Box got its name because it was sort of a speak easy type place in the past. Local folk would come here on Summers evenings to play cards, etc. to escape the Missouri heat. 
Original owners donated the land to the state, to prevent development.

This is a nice little state park just outside of Columbia, Missouri.  The Rock Bridge and Devil's Icebox are part of a collapsed cave system.  There is a wooden half mile trail that takes you to both and is very easy to walk along.  There are a few overlooks to stop at along the way with displays that explain the geological processes taking place and the wildlife (bats, trogolobites) inside the cave.

Rockbridge is a great park with many trails of varying length and difficulties. None are too strenuous though so don't fret! They are generally pretty good about blazing the trails well but there are some spots where things get mixed up. The scenery is beautiful!

Great place to hike. Dog friendly. Beautiful. Options for the many levels of hiking from beginning to moderate. My only complaints are that there are a Ton of stairs, some loose boards, and it is very slick when wet.

I always have a good time at RBSP. I take my dog out every once in a while to home the sinkhole trail. It can be a bit muddy if there's been any rain, but if that's the case the devil's icebox trail is mostly boarded walkway, so there's always somewhere to go. Glad we have such a pretty park to visit nearby.

name: Align Chiropractic Clinic
address: 3306 Emerald Ln A, Jefferson City, MO 65109, USA
reviews: Dr. Johns and his crew are always friendly! They get you in an and out quickly but they also take the time to listen to you! They are also very reasonably priced!
Dr. Johns and his staff are amazing. They take the time to educate you and answer any questions you may have and you never getting the feel that they are rushing to get to the next patient.

After enduring 5 years of chronic pain and going to many doctors I felt very hopeless. Since finding Dr. John I have learned that he is affordable, compassionate, & knowledgeable. He is prob one of the nicest Dr's you will ever meet. He never makes you feel rushed. He puts all your anxieties to ease. He has the best office staff ever. Love those girls! ❤  I feel like I'm on the mend. Jefferson City has a Gem. I can't say enough about his office.
EXCELLENT STAFF AND EXPLANATION OF CHIROPRACTIC CARE, FIRST TREATMENT APPOINTMENT  AND I FEEL 100% BETTER.
The best caring group you’ll ever find.   They are the greatest!   Helping me so much and I know that if you’ll give them a try they’ll help you too!

name: Painted Rock Conservation Area
address: Westphalia, MO 65085, USA
reviews: camped out, despite the rain cold weather and the fish not biting at the lake, I had a wonderful time with a very very dear friend. We did catch some fish in the river and a nice Buzz as well.

This is a nice park for hiking, camping, and fishing. The trails are easy and good for any age or fitness level. The views are awesome. The camping is nice. There are three entrances to the park, so preplanning is necessary.

Excellent walking trail with beautiful overlooks of the Osage River.  Very peaceful and quiet and a good workout as well.
     If you can't walk down hills or up inclines, you may not want to tackle this walk as it is a little rocky in areas and can be slick when wet and challenging in the heat.

1.6 mile trail, two viewpoints of the Osage, took my GF and I about 1 hour to hike the trail with our dogs.  Great scenery and absolutely beautiful!! I'm 65 with bad knees. Trail is kinda rugged but I made it with ease. Several benches along the trail to rest on. Great hike!!!
Good place for hiking.

name: Stark Caverns
address: 125 Cave Dr, Eldon, MO 65026, USA
reviews: Went by today with our 2 young boys on vacation.  Had a great time, it was just our family on the 12 noon tour, which was kinda cool to get a personalized tour.  Thanks to Lee our tour guide for taking us through the 4 level cave!  Many great features that we got to see close up.  Our 6 & 8 boys were very focused and like it.  Lee "played" well to the kids.  Warm inside the cave.  Had as nice gift shop with souvenirs and nature books for kids etc.  Cool clothing options.  They were getting ready for a really cool Valentine's event on the cave which may be why when we first showed up the door was locked and we didn't see anyone at first.  But then someone came to help us, that would be the only negative of the experience.  Keep in mind their tours are 10, 12, 2 and 4 each day.

Wow!!!! Paula is an AMAZING guide! She knows her stuff and is super friendly and helpful. Staff appeared knowledgeable and professional and the caverns are beautiful! I suggest spending a little more money for the Black Light Tour. We had an amazing experience and will definitely be back!!! (Also, the gift shop prices are appropriate and affordable). Love it!!!!!!!!

This was so much fun! I did the black light cave tour and the woman that was our tour guide was absolutely AMAZING. She was very knowledgeable and taught us about the caves, mineral deposits, how the formations are made and even taught us about luminescence. Very cool experience. If you have a chance to go, I highly recommend getting on her tour. Great experience!
This Cavern is super cool with 4 shelves to explore lots of Beauty and history a must-see for cave lovers! Tour guides are awesome very informative friendly and considerate.

I just went to Stark Caverns after seeing all the positive reviews online, this place is phenomenal. It’s worth noting that I got there an hour before the first tour and would’ve missed it due to my flight, but Paula (the tour guide) was able to bring me, so a huge thank you for that... The caves themselves are absolutely amazing, so many millions of years of geologic history, you’ll see countless different types of formations. It’s just absolutely intriguing, especially to hear all the history of the cave intermixed with the geologic aspects on the tour. They’ve also done a magnificent job of lighting the caves In a way that blends in without detracting from their natural beauty. I’ve been in several different game systems at this point, and each has their own flavor and character, Stark Caverns is an absolute must see whether it’s your first time or you’re a seasoned caver... One last note, there are actual ancient physical human remains on display that were found in the cave and interred respectfully, adding a level of gravity to the experience that you won’t get anywhere else. Thank you guys for an amazing tour!

name: Stephens Lake Park
address: 2001 E Broadway, Columbia, MO 65201, USA
reviews: Really wonderful large park in the middle of Columbia, bringing nature to the city. Has lots of small pavilions around and multiple playgrounds, plus lots of empty space great for small gatherings or other outside activities.
Well designed park with something for everyone. Free swimming and splash  fountain in the  summer. It's a great place to walk or jog.

A Park that rivals other City Parks in similar sized communities.  Having a Memorial Bench and Heritage Tree in this Park makes it extra special for me and my family to visit from time to time.  The Lake is large, clear and defines the heart of the space.  With an interior paved walking path around the perimeter of the Lake, as well as a longer paved walking and running trail the Park gives persons options for leisure walking and exercise / fitness pursuits.   An amphitheater provides outdoor concerts and a venue for special annual events such as Roots-N-Blues-N-BBQ in the Fall.   The Park is also home to the Annual Art in the Park event and a perfect backdrop for patrons of the arts to enjoy viewing the creations of artists from around the United States.   A Splash-Park is also another feature of Stephens Lake Park and one very suitable for children.
Beautiful park! Nice walking trail and plenty of field to host family outings

A very open and beautiful park with docks and walkways on the lake, a playground, small waterfalls and plenty of benches to sit down and relax to just enjoy nature. The bathrooms could certainly use more care, but this is the only issue I have with this park. It's a wonderful place for a picnic, gathering, or just a place to get away and relax.

name: Shelter Gardens
address: 1817 W Broadway, Columbia, MO 65218, USA
reviews: A rare and beautiful example of a formal garden with plant varieties in abundance.  It is evident that the Shelter Insurance Company has invested time, money, and thoughtful planning in this oasis of a park on the edge of Columbia.  With the corporate buildings nearby, and a large apartment complex bordering one side of the gardens, it is still quiet, peaceful, and serene.  A place where one can go to walk, be alone, be quiet in an otherwise noisy world.  Time set aside in Shelter Gardens to think, pray, meditate, wander aimlessly, or spread a blanket and lay underneath a canopy of clouds is time well spent.  A true treasure of Columbia, Missouri and not to be missed at any season of the year.
Great place to go with family or by yourself. Covered shelter available and paved path to walk on. Especially beautiful in spring or fall. A favorite for my family.

Peaceful, well-maintained Park with paved pathways winding around the 5 acre property. Enjoy multiple water features & waterfall with coy pond. I liked that all of the vegetation & tree variations were labeled. All 5 senses go to work & I can imagine how this place must look fully bloomed on a sunny day (cloudy morning today). There's also an old schoolhouse you can walk into, sit down or leave your mark on the chalkboards. Love this place!
Great place to spend time with family but some area were not properly maintained and there were street dogs everywhere.

Beautiful and tranquil, the perfect place to just walk or sit, and put your mind at ease.... or have a picnic! This gorgeous outdoor area also offers an educational benefit to botany students, or any green thumb enthusiast, as all the trees and shrubs are labeled. Another plus to this already free-to-public outdoor area is that it makes a great photo op for any occasion, complete with stone pathways, fountains, flowers, evergreens, a gazebo and even and old school house!  Doggy mess bag/drop off stations are  available at the entry to help maintain the garden's cleanliness.

name: Runge Nature Center
address: 330 Commerce Dr, Jefferson City, MO 65109, USA
reviews: What a gem! This center is absolutely beautiful, and has so much to offer. It makes learning about our surroundings fun for people of all ages. Worth a visit if you’re in the area!

Such a beautiful place to hike and enjoy nature. There are creeks, trails and so much wildlife. There is also a center that the public can go inside and find many facts about the wildlife around the area.
Excellent opportunity to learn more about Missouri presented here.
This was a great place to visit. The staff there was so friendly and knowledgeable.  The trails were clear, the exhibits and displays were fun and informative.
One of our favorite places to go, wonderful activities inside. Amazing wildlife to interact with, beautiful trails.

name: Grindstone Nature Area
address: 2011 Old 63 S, Columbia, MO 65201, USA
reviews: Awesome park, has leash and off leash areas. Clean restrooms and a water fountain you can actually drink from. Lots of shade and nature trails tucked away along the main path. Also, great for biking too. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Phenomenal local hiking trail. Great overhead tree coverage to share the trail. Well maintained walkways. Great immediately next to trail is trimmed down to reduce insects, especially ticks. Off leash area.
Beautiful little spot, used it a couple times now as a pit stop when driving through Columbia. Really pretty and seems like it's connected to a trail network

A beautiful stroll along the Grindstone Creek is a must to calm body, mind and spirit.  A very well-paved path, amply wide, meanders along the Creek where birds are in abundance.  Nestled in the niche valley houses and automobiles are not visible to the carefree walk through Nature.

An overlooked trail in COMO. More curves than MKT but gives more scenic look. From rivers to meadows to woods to open clearings. Flat but some slight inclines. Connects to MKT as well. Great hiking areas and spaces for dogs off leash.

name: Supplement Superstore
address: 1922 Missouri Blvd a, Jefferson City, MO 65109, USA
reviews: I called the Jefferson City store yesterday and told them what I wanted. I asked for some tips and if they would do curbside pickup because of this whole virus thing! They are doing that, but they offered me free delivery! I was like well heck yes! They took my information and i got my items delivered to me within 20minutes. They were friendly, fast and efficient! Also you can’t beat the prices! They were much cheaper than online! Thank you guys!!! I really appreciate it!

I was super nervous to make a supplement purchase because it can be big financially. I called Gavin at Supplement Superstores. He was incredibly helpful answering all of my questions, and he gave me the most information  possible about the products in question. WONDERFUL customer service and WONDERFUL products.

I went in and as soon as I walked in i was greeted and asked if i could use any help. She helped me pick up so protein powder for what I need. I have a lot of allergies and she knew right away what i should use.  And at the end she told me about a place I can meet up with others and work out since I am a single mom and don't have a lot of time on my hands. SO overall great experience.

Started on a new journey last night at the Supplement Superstore.  What a wonderful experience.  Gavin was very knowledgeable & assisted me in understanding the mechanics of the system in nutrition & exercise.  Thank you, Gavin!

I highly recommend Supplement Superstore.  You could not ask for better assistance in regard to supplements, diet, nutrition, & exercise.

I have visited the JC Supplement Superstore a couple of times in the last 2 months and Gavin has been there both times to help me out.  Even though I knew exactly what I wanted, he visited with me and helped me find everything I needed.  He was very pleasant, upbeat, and positive.  He also asked me if I had any questions or was interested in trying anything new.  I definitely always enjoy my time while I am there.  I love the products as well.

name: Auto World Museum
address: 200 Peacock Dr, Fulton, MO 65251, USA
reviews: Cool place, lots of cars, friendly.

Auto World Museum is absolutely Terrific. Alit of mint condition vintage cars. Who would think there were "all" those cars inside this building in Fulton, MO. A gotta stop and view if interested 
In Top Rate Vintage Cars *****
If you like history and antique automobiles this is it. A must see.  Worth the trip.
It's good for Callaway county and my dear sweet Granny "Peggy Hawkins Thomas" is in a old time down town blown up picture!! 🥰

Nice collection of about 80 cars. There's neat backdrops so the cars look like they're in the right time period. Lots to see and read about the cars, and some rare cars we hadn't seen before. A bit small but packed full of cars. There's a solar car, a DeLorean, an electric Renault, a Cord, and a whole lot more.

name: Museum of Art and Archaeology
address: 115 Business Loop 70 W, Columbia, MO 65211, USA
reviews:
This is not a stand-alone museum, but rather a series of galleries in a university building. Nonetheless, there is a good range of art and artifacts to check out. While there are few iconic works, the antiquities collection is extensive and nicely curated. Objects are well-labeled, but the European and American galleries lack introductory level labels. I also hope that there are numbers to help match objects to labels in the antiquities galleries, as it isn't always easy to figure out the pictorial guides.

I don't know why this place is separate from the downtown and campus areas of Columbia, but I think it is worth a little extra effort to come here when you are in town. Admission is free, and the staff are very helpful. Last but not least, be sure to pay a visit to the Museum of Anthropology next door. Who would have thought that it is home to "one of the largest and most comprehensive [archery collections] in the world"? Not to mention that local archaeology and history are presented there as well.

Parking and entrance is free. Exhibits are split between the first and second floor. This was moved from the main campus when their building was being renovated. It is in an old cancer research building and renamed Mizzou campus north. The first exhibit and the largest is to the right as you enter the main doors under the covered drop off entrance.  The gift shop is in front of you to the left and the elevator is just past the gift shop. The stairs are also just to the left as you come in. When you come out of the elevator turn left to go to the exhibits. Coming out of the stairs it is a slight left then right.  I mention all of this since it isn't obvious unless someone is there to assist you as you come in. The exhibits are wonderful. Most seem to be permanent installations with a few that cycle in and out. The north campus location is nice since you don't have to fight campus traffic or pay for parking. It is close to I-70 and could be a quick stop while driving through town.
Awesome place to visit and is free!!! Donations are welcome and well-deserved. A lot of work is clearly put into the upkeep. Very nice exhibits.
Small free University Museum.  Some pretty cool items in the collection,  well curated,  and the right price.  Worth checking out if you find yourself in the COMO area.
A pleasant little find in Columbia. Relatively small but some great pieces.

name: Miner Mike's Inc
address: 4515 Osage Beach Pkwy, Osage Beach, MO 65065, USA
reviews: Amazing place to visit! Of the many attractions and amusement parks that we have been too, minor Mike's remains a top favorite! The staff Is quick to service, super friendly, and everything there is very reasonably priced. We travel two hours to enjoy this little gem because we feel it's well worth it. Highly recommend if you have never been.

Nice place for kids to escape from the heat. Fun for all ages. Go-karts were a family favorite. The maze entertained the kids for hours. The games were affordable, however a few were not working the day we visited. The train ride was also not operational due to track maintenance.

Absolutely a kid favorite place.  The kids maze is HUGE! All of the ride lines are extremely short, and most of the time you get directly on. The go-karts are FAST! Trouble with arcade games, the staff usually fix immediately.  The pizza is very good and priced accordingly as well.
A truly great place for the whole family to have a great time with many options for entertainment

The place was nice. My son enjoyed playing in their maze indoor playground. Some of the arcade machines were not working though. The Jurassic Park arcade game was very exciting to play with. The go kart was good too since they have a good space to run the kart around. 
The prizes were all right. I really appreciate one of the staff who gave my son a free small toy since I did not redeem the tickets he won from the arcade coz I was planning to get more tickets for a better toy. He saw my son looking at the prizes and he gave him something small but really touched my heart and made my little boy smile. Great to see you have a staff who is sensitive and has a big heart. I did not get his name but I hope the management will notice that kind of person.

name: Francis Quadrangle
address: 410 S 6th St, Columbia, MO 65211, USA
reviews: One of the most beautiful university scenes ANYWHERE in the world. A classic. Be sure to check out one of the newer features, the bronze Thomas Jefferson, along with his original obelisk-shaped grave-marker, on the East side of the quadrangle.
It gives a historic vibe, with a glimpse of both the past (older pillars) and present (Jesse Hall). A good fresh place to chill out.
One of the most pristine places of Mizzou! The green and the architecture is always pleasure to eyes.
Always a nice place up take a walk.
Great place to be. Love the tradition and the historic value. May be the most photographic place in the campus.

name: Lake of the Ozarks State Park
reviews: We went down during the off season, but a beautiful weekend. We stayed at the campground, which was pretty much empty, and did some fishing. This is a beautiful area. We will definitely be back. Five stars for sure!

Beautiful area to sit and relax. We saw plenty of wild life, did some trails, and explored a bit.  We built fires just about every night.  The cabin we stayed in was adorable, had a small kitchen, dining and living area with a loft bedroom. Be sure to bring more than enough of your essentials. We stayed in cabins that provided the basics but if we hadn’t brought our own we would have run out.

We arrived at the campground with a new trailer and were pleasantly surprised to find flat pads, great hookups and very clean bathrooms and showers.  The sites are well maintained and litter free.  Hosts are very courteous,  friendly and helpful.  Swimming beach was also really nice and empty given we arrived after labor day.  Highly recommend camping here.  Good value for the sites.
Great place to camp.  We went in winter and the park was very well maintained.   The camping sites all had great views of the lake!
Many quiet private coves with no houses or bars.  Photo shows party cove which is not representative of touring by boat or anchoring to swim.

name: Eagle Bluffs Overlook
address: Katy Trail, Columbia, MO 65203, USA
reviews: Nice walking path from the parking area to the lookout.  Fantastic views
Beautiful view! Don't follow Google's directions though, you can't get here by road. Park by Eagle Bluffs at the Katy trail and bike over on the trail.
A must stop if you are biking the Katy trail. The climb is steep, but not tremendously hard or dangerous. If you do the climb, you are rewarded with a spectacular view of the Missouri River valley.
The climb is pretty easy and short with a beautiful view at the top.

The difficulty of the trail depends on which entrance you come from. If you are coming from the Katy trail (~6 mile round trip from McBaine), be prepared for a steep uphill climb. If you are coming from Warren School Road, it is a very pleasant, easy walk. The view is fantastic and well worth the trip from either direction. 

It's best to visit this spot in the late fall, winter, and early spring, as it can be a tick haven the rest of the year (the reason why I've rated this trail 4/5 stars). I have also seen the occasional wasp and yellow jacket, so beware! 

Good place to have a quick picnic as long as you visit when the bugs aren't too bad.

name: Cosmo-Bethel Park
address: 4500 Bethel St, Columbia, MO 65203, USA
reviews: Great place for kids of all ages theres playing areas, picnic areas, trails to walk waters to fish in.

The playground is excellent. That's not why we were there but I would definitely take my kid there. We were there to watch the sunset and discovered that there was a beautiful pond with a paved path all the way around. It was lovely to sit and watch the sunset, and we would have stayed longer if I had remembered the bug spray.
Love the park and it's contours. My kids and  I enjoy it a lot.

Columbia Missouri boast several fantastic city parks and this is certainly one of them. Beautiful views on the easy hike around the pond. The path is paved so eventhough it had been raining our walk was pleasant and not muddy.  The kids were enjoying the large playground as we devoured our dessert in one of the shelters on the grounds.

Plenty of kid spaces as well as walking path around the lake. Shelters have bbq pits and there is a nice sand area for volleyball. Main downside is distance to restrooms and the usual metal Park toilets

name: Ha Ha Tonka State Park
address: 1491 Missouri D, Camdenton, MO 65020, USA
reviews: We started our 2 1/2 hour road trip in Alba, MO and ended up here at the amazing Ha Ha Tonka State Park. I originally only cared about seeing the castle remains, but found the Natural Bridge absolutely stunning. Unfortunately rain was on the way and my ankle was not cooperating. We only got to see a tiny bit of this EPIC park and now i plan to come back soon and be prepared with backpacks, snacks and proper hiking attire. It's so huge, one of the trails will take over 6 hours to hike! I can't wait to mark that off my bucket list! Best of all, FREE!

Yesterday was a great day to visit this amazing natural wonder. And we were extra blessed, to find that the waterfall over the backside of the Natural Bridge was flowing due to the recent rain. I highly recommend this park for anyone waiting to take in Nature's Beauty, but if you can catch it after a rain and catch that waterfall, it was just breathtaking. Also, we had the chance to visit with a couple of the park rangers that were super nice.

A beautiful state park that is part of what the Lake of the Ozarks is known for! Go see a burnt down castle, check out a serene natural spring, hike a collection of different trails, climb hundreds of merciless steps, i love it all! They also have covered areas for eating lunch and some with playgrounds for teh kids. If you want some more thorough and interesting information on the park visit  the visitors center located at the entrance of the park. Worth a trip, good FREE all day fun!
This area is beautiful and there is so much to see. The staff was very nice and helpful as well. Definitely plan on spending an hour or two here.

Awesome place to walk and sight see. Things like this.. NaTuRaL undisturbed beauty are abundant in Missouri . Come see Us here and we'll live up to the famed name and "Show you what the Show-Me State is all about . "

name: Jacob's Cave
address: 23114 Hwy Tt, Versailles, MO 65084, USA
reviews: The cave was very cool. I didn't give it 5 stars because the tour guide seemed a little less than happy to be there and the souvenir shop didn't have much stuff that was actually from the cave or made locally, which was disappointing. But seeing it was a neat experience. It was definitely chilly and I would recommend a sweater but you could make it without. I wore sandals and I was fine but the floor is a bit wet and there is dripping water so I would recommend tennis shoes. Definitely interesting and a fun memory.
Very knowledgeable staff and an awesome tour. Lots to learn and see. My kids loved it, and so did we.

I had the good fortune to stumble upon Jacob’s Cave on a Google search ahead of a trip to Missouri. I got there right when they opened so I was able to get a one on one tour with a young woman whose family owns and operates the cave. Even though the cave is millions of years old, it is very much an active system, with an incredible diversity of geologic structures being created right before your very eyes, with water snaking its way through every nook and cranny of the cave system, almost giving the illusion that the system itself is alive. I’ve been in several different caves at this point across Missouri and Kentucky and this one was one of the most fascinating, due to the completely unique combination of various formations. The tour itself was interesting and engaging the whole time, with the guide knowing all about the history of the cave, the geology that created it, and various other observations that made it a unique and rewarding experience all around. If you’re remotely near this part of Missouri, I highly suggest you drop by and take the tour, you won’t be disappointed.

This was a great experience with my family.  Our tour guide made it especially fun and interesting. We went during spring break, which I understand to be kind of the off season; so no wait and a private tour for the five of us. Remember to bring your phone or camera in to take pics and video clips.

A cool place with all kinds of neat features to tour! There was a nice path to follow into the cave, it was close to 1/2 a mile deep into the rock, & the guide was very knowledgeable while providing a fun tour

name: Bothwell Lodge State Historic Site
address: 19349 Bothwell State Park Rd, Sedalia, MO 65301, USA
reviews:
Amazing historical location! Our tour guide Amanda was incredibly informative and we'll versed in the history and artifacts in the estate! Beautiful area with lots of unique facts about the original owner/builder/local philanthropist! We would definitely like to take the tour again!

FYI, the tour has over 200 stairs and no AC, so be prepared.
Incredible view. Restrooms. Trails. Watch for ticks. Informational. Interesting!

There's not a whole lot to do in Sedalia, so make sure you visit this sensationally preserved historic home. Only $4 for a tour to help Missouri State Parks stay beautiful. Emma was a great tour guide. Fun, informative, worth it. 
(Also, pretty sure Mr. Bothwell was actually Bruce Wayne.)

When I moved here, I thought this was a mansion nestled in the side of a hill. I wanted to live there. 
But it's a beautiful place to have picnics and walks, and even run the trails. 
I've take many photos here also. This place makes a beautiful backdrop for portraits and senior pictures. 
It's gorgeous in Fall.
Very good your guide.  Everything is very well maintained!  Would have loved to tour the grounds, but it was raining!

name: Finger Lakes State Park
address: 1505 Peabody Rd, Columbia, MO 65202, USA
reviews:
While this is a beautiful area, the park is really not for me, as I visit state parks to commune with nature, and this is one of Missouri's two state parks which allow ATVs. I don't want to hear the roar of those engines as they whiz past me! If you don't mind the noise, the park does have a lot to offer,, such as a campground (with a playground), and opportunities for a variety of other activities, including boating (electric motors only), canoeing, kayaking, swimming, fishing, picnicking, hiking, mountain biking, and metal detecting.
The park has an interesting history, as the area was once known as Peabody Coal Company's Mark Twain Mine (1964- 1967). The company donated the land to the State in 1974, for use as a park. We really enjoyed the scenery, the noise, not so much.

There's more to do than riding off-road vehicles. Canoe ($25/day) and kayak ($15.90@2hr) rentals, mountain bike trails, swimming, and beautiful picnic sites. Stayed in early September through the week with only one other camper here. A couple off road vehicles were at the park but not heard from at camp site 16. The park attractions are a distance apart, camp sites are large, clean bathrooms and showers and an organized and helpful park office. I've been to most Missouri state park campgrounds and this modern, well-maintained park has to be one of my favorites.

I grew up going to finger lakes and Rocky Fork! There's just about anything outside you want to do here. This is a great place for camping Motocross fishing they have a firing range at Rocky Fork. And there's times when I actually go out here and do nothing more than just walk off into the woods and have some peaceful time to myself and the best part is it's really not that far out of the city so I don't have to travel long distances to go out and enjoy nature without having a whole mess of people around me destroying but I'm trying to enjoy!

One of my favorite State Parks. One of the few State Park where you can ride ATV'S. The park has quite a few trails to ride and explore. The park has a very nice shooting range with a dedicated pigeon shooting area. Also has a lake though it's fairly small and the swimming beach isn't much. Things to know $5 per person to ride if you're a Missouri resident.  You need a helmet and a flag on the bike. No passengers unless your bike is designed for one. Area does have a loading/unloading dock.

The state takes 5 star care of the park. It’s a great resource. I give it 4 stars because sometimes idiots go out there and have no idea of gun safety. We leave then. We don’t use the make or the 4 wheel park.

name: Bridal Cave
address: 526 Bridal Cave Rd, Camdenton, MO 65020, USA
reviews: The tour was short :( there were a couple of nice photo moments, it was not where they take your picture once you first enter the cave :/ I enjoyed natural bridge caverns in Texas better but each cave is unique. It's good to go onto it once. I personally enjoyed sleucing for the gems the 30$ bag is the better option...we split it between 3 kids and got prettier gems compared to the emerald bag which was 13$.

On December 21st, 2019, my mom got married in Bridal Cave. It was a gorgeous and unique wedding, and how often can you say that you attended a wedding in a cave? The staff there were super friendly and helpful, informative, professional, and the shop was a really cool place to buy jewelry and trinkets that will always remind us of that day. Not to mention how gorgeous the cave is.

Bridal cave is an amazing attraction offering a neat tour experience and beautiful cave draperies.  There are a couple places that you have to be able to get through that are a bit tight, but overall it’s definitely worth it!  Also the scenic overlooks around the property are spectacular!
Awesome, awesome tour. If you go, make sure you have Beth as your guide!! She makes this an awesome experience!!

Such a beautiful place to go and see. You will learn so much information about the cave and cave systems in general. The store is full of great quality items and everything is reasonably priced as well. This is a place that everyone of all ages can enjoy and will always remember.

name: Centennial Park
address: 1400 E 16th St, Sedalia, MO 65301, USA
reviews: The park was clean, toys are in good shape. New construction was in progress.  Lots of benches for seating.  Nice shelter for picnics. Adequate parking. Busy day at the park, however it was not crowded. Pleasant park to visit with children of varying ages.

First time to this pool in Sedalia. Enjoyed how much room there is for swimmers to swim interrupted. Could use some more shading and seating for guests. Thank you to the pool staff for making our day great! ✌😁
Excellent family fun. Plenty of playgrounds, alot of open spaces and picnic tables.  Nice size pool with slides.

Baseball, tee ball, and softball fields. basket ball court. Paved walking trails,  lot of grass and shade. Even a creek running through with their own covered bridge. plenty of play ground equipment, with the major bonus of being wheel chair or stroller accessible. Several bathrooms, drinking fountains, and many shelters. They also provide bags for little bins for those people who forget to bring along a sack to clean up after their pets. Every summer one of the biggest draws is the pool with the water slide, only maybe 5ft deep it's made for the smaller children/families the teens usually end up across town at liberty. They also have a lift to help people with disabilities in and out of the pool.

This is the park I grew up going to. Glad to see the recent improvements to the lighting and shelters, but disappointed that the new shelters dont have charcoal grills like the old ones did. They were very handy for family events and birthday parties.

name: Daum Museum of Contemporary Art
address: 3201 W 16th St, Sedalia, MO 65301, USA
reviews:
I was taking classes when the Daum Museum was added. All of my art classes were in the building they added it to. 
Beautiful museum and I try to visit when a new artist's work is on display.
Free concert with the Kay Brothers full house
Very interesting art. Not traditional but tastefully done.  Very relaxing experience.
Always a beautiful display of art!!  I am so glad we have such an amazing place here in Sedalia ,MO
Small, fantastic collection of modern art.

name: Pikes Camp Access
address: Westphalia, MO 65085, USA
reviews:
It's a place my hubby and I go to build a fire, roast hotdogs and toast marshmallows. We enjoy the outdoors and being together. its peaceful and quiet AND NOT ONCE HAVE WE BEEN HARASSED! Its just a peaceful
place.
One of the best boat ramps/camp site in these parts
Nice peaceful place along the Osage River
Great place to put in, yet the river is down this time of year. Don't expect to go more than a mile in either direction unless you have a jon boat or jet boat. Primitive camping about 6 spots.
Excellent place for camping !

name: Lazer Force Lazer Tag
address: 5473 Osage Beach Pkwy, Osage Beach, MO 65065, USA
reviews: It's like we walked into the movie, Wreck It Ralph! Nostalgia and FUN for our whole family! Clean, helpful and lots of game options for many levels of skill or age!!! If you come for the laser tag, 20 minutes was plenty for our family! The laser tag arena is a really creative and thought out maze. We had a great time!

I have loved this place for years. The arcade is great, the prizes are so cool and seem very well priced compared to other arcade places. The Lazer tag is the best part, every time I'm at the lake you will most definitely see me here. Great for large and small groups, even 1v1 matches. The vests at well taken care of and register hits very nicely. And the staff is so kind and helpful as well.
Amazing place to go! Fun for everyone! Perfect for teen groups and perfect for parties!

A lot of fun.. very reasonably priced, and a BIG play area (they have a very large downstairs game area.  Played with my kids here and we all had a blast!  They also have extremely detailed printouts at the end that tell you EVERYTHING about your game play.  Well worth the visit and will definitely come back again!
Great place for young and older children. Friendly staff and lots of fun had.

name: Genesis Laser & Vein
address: 2511 W Edgewood Dr, Jefferson City, MO 65109, USA
reviews: I've been going here for over 2 years and have seen great improvement in my legs.  I don't have  the restlessness or cramping like  I  used to. My legs feel  and look better. Vein disease runs in my family so I'm doing what I need to do to keep my legs healthy.  I pay an insurance co-pay, but insurance pays for the treatments.

Dr Prasad treated my veins and it was life changing. There was such a heavy feeling in my legs I had trouble doing everything.  I did whatever I could to avoid walking. Since treatment I have so much energy and I have my life back. I am catching up on all of the things I couldn’t do before. Thank you to Dr Prasad and your amazing staff!  Everyone is so thoughtful and friendly.

I’ve had a wonderful experience with every appointment thus far! From consult to post op visits. Dr. Prasad does a great job of explaining procedures, before, during and what to expect after. Very thorough! Stephanie, took control of my most recent visit, and she did an amazing job! Thanks for always being helpful and enjoyable!
Since beginning treatment at Genesis, my energy is improved, heaviness and pain have subsided, and I know Dr Prasad and staff will continue to monitor and tweak if necessarily

The doctor and the staff at JCMG vein center is wonderful, competent and friendly.  I have been having my veins treated and I  wore shorts this year for the first time in 30 years.  They also removed an unsightly blue spot on my lip and various moles.  My daughter also had her veins treated and they look so much better.   I cant recommend them more highly.  The doctor is so nice and considerate.  And fresh coffee!  The know how to handle insurance issues, and medicare pays for most of the treatment.

name: Boathenge
address: Columbia, MO 65203, USA
reviews: A very interesting attraction,  I am still not sure if you are actually allowed on the property as the entrance is marked as private property. You can access it from the Katy Trail, which in itself worth visiting. A bit creepy, but I feel it added positively to the experience.
If you are biking the Katy trail be sure to stop. Fun place to grab some pictures and enjoy the unusual display...
Locals love this place.
The drive in was rough gravel, and the boats are on private property so you can't get close to them without trespassing, but 10/10, best free doggo escort in the land.
A pretty spot by the river, great for those who need to break up their road trip with a little walk. Plus there were good dogs.

name: Woodridge Park
address: 3532 Berrywood Dr, Columbia, MO 65201, USA
reviews: Such a neat park. The area is quiet, the playground is in great shape and there is a variety of things to play on. We really enjoyed the slide that has all the little rolling bars along with that round swing.
I went with my grandkids. They started to play but, then came the rain. So, would like to go again when it is not raining.
The new play area is really nice. It's in a great area; clean, safe and very close to the new Columbia trail system. My 6 yr old loves spending time there.
Good park in Mountain View, Calfornia for children.
Love this park. Its fenced in and is partly shaded

name: Ha Ha Tonka Castle Ruins
address: Natural Bridge Rd, Camdenton, MO 65020, USA
reviews: The Castle ruins are easy to get to. Very limited parking. Wear good hiking shoes and bring a walking staff. There are hundred of steps to climb and it is a steep climb on the stairs. But a very beautiful place to visit.

I love to go hiking and finally had the opportunity to explore this beautiful property. We went on one of the last warm days of the year so the trails were pretty busy but still a very pleasurable experience. The castle is immaculate and the remains are beautiful. This is a hike you could make last an hour or two and spend the night with their six mile trail with a campsite. Those steps are not for the weak. They were a challenge but worth every step. I will definitely be back soon to explore more!!
Lot to enjoy..ruins of castle in good shape..then stone water tower  to photo...and can take the steps down hillside to enjoy the spring fed stream into lake. Great scenery pictures .

Very cool history behind this place. 
Wish you could enter the ruins, but I get it. 
Got to rule for the masses...
Overlooking the head waters of the the Lake of the Ozarks, bunch of cool history, the man, the time it took to build. 
If you are into geeking out on Americana, and who we once were? Must see.
Super cool park with amazing views! You can't go in the ruins, but it's neat to see the castle. But what really makes this park amazing is their trails! Even the short ones are well worth the trip

name: The Peach Tree Farm
address: 24863 MO-98, Boonville, MO 65233, USA
reviews: Loved our visit here. Very unique experience. Enjoyed picking pumpkins and gourds straight off the vine. They also have lots of different animals to see and some to pet. Prices are reasonable. I seriously wanted one of the really big pumpkins but settled for a picture instead. Great place to take kids. Worth the trip.
Cute little maze and a hayride. Had some pumpkins to buy and some goats and a few other animals to feed. Not much else tho. But had some nice picture taking spots. No food or drinks sold there.

We went to Peachtree farm house on weekend right before a week of Halloween. The farm was pretty small, it may be great for infants with parents but no-go for group of adults or friends together. The installations are small, very few animals, hay ride was kind of short and lame, may be better for kids. The maze was only for kids, they must expand the attractions and install attractions for adults and teenagers.
Great place, good things to do..highly recommend..

Pretty neat little place. Definitely worth the $6. Great for small children and enough things to keep the parents entertained for a while as well. Don't forget to save some of your feed for the goats in the back

name: Meramec Caverns
address: 1135 Hwy W, Sullivan, MO 63080, USA
reviews: Amazing tour, shop, set-up, caves, everything overall. The biggest perk is for those traveling with a furry, four legged family members. The have large, outdoor, dog kennels that you can use. You'll put a deposit down on a padlock with key, that you'll use to put your pooch in, while you're on the cave tour. Take a water bowl and water in case it's hot. The tour is unique and is both educational and entertaining. Highly recommend, you won't be disappointed!
Awesome Tour with great tour guide. Beautiful gift shop. A lovely area to visit with many attractions for families. Would love to return in the summer! Thank you!
Cool place!  Awesome views on the river. Nice gift shop! Zip line over the river, take a cave tour, canoe the river. On site camp grounds or a small hotel all in one location.

Beautiful place to visit .it's a guide tour and if you go in big group like 15 people or above you will get some discounts tickets . Beautiful light and sound show and a mother in law's tongue 😜too. Fall they do science exhibits best for school field trips. If few places I felt it is good for Wedding photo shoots too. Other activities are there around this place. Camping area,boating,zipline etc. Restrooms are clean and beautiful staff is helpful. Food area is also available.
Very beautiful cavern. Very pricey and tourist orientated. Tours were good and informative. Our tour guide Conner was very funny and nice.

name: Prison Brews
address: 305 Ash St, Jefferson City, MO 65101, USA
reviews: I really wanted to like this place. The atmosphere was great. Cool concept and cool building. The service was average at best. The food we had was below average. The drinks were good although. Seems to be parking on the street, fun place to come. Just hope for a better food and service experience next time!

The beer was okay... we attempted to try new beer twice however we kept getting the same beer we previously ordered. The pizza could have been great however it was literally cheese with bbq sauce and barely any chicken. The onion rings were great and the atmosphere was cool. All together this place has potential but needs some work.

Was anxious to try this place.  Have heard good things and tried to go a couple times before but it was too busy to get in.  Went today (Sunday) and got right in for lunch early (around 11am).  The place was not busy at all.  Drinks and food order right away and then we waited....around an hour and 15 minutes for sandwiches and fries.  I ordered a reuben and I attached a photo below.  Everything on the plate was cold.  There was one piece of corned beef on the sandwich.  Toward the side where it looks like more the one piece it was folded to fit on the sandwich.  Servers were completely unapologetic about the wait.  In fact I am not sure who our server was because it looked like they kept trading off.  All that being said we won't be back.

Absolutely awesome meal!  We had the cheese and bread appetizer.  To be clear, it's cube cheese (pepper jack, cheddar and swiss).  It was so good, I took the leftovers home.  Additionally, we ordered the grilled chicken and bacon sandwich and ruben, both with fries.  We would order both again!  They even have great sweet tea!  I highly recommend visiting Prison Brews in Jeff City.  The only downside is parking, but I'm not taking away from the rating for something the business can't control.
This was a very busy day for these guys but they hung in there and powered through. Great teamwork, great team outlook. Over alll it’s was awesome.

name: Mecca Farm
address: Roach, MO 65787, USA
reviews: We LOVE MECCA Pumpkin Patch! We go every year! Love the crafts u can make (Scarecrow & Fall signs) and their photo opp this year! There is something fun for every age and man or woman!
What a fun day of activities. The weather was great. You have to go.Thanks Clay
GREAT FAMILY FUN!!!!!  We all really enjoyed ourselves!  We will teturn!
My family had a ton of fun there.Lots of thimgs to do for the kids. Not over priced like a lot of places like these. Clay, Melissa and their kids are super good people. This is a must see.
Kids really have a good time. There is stuff for the grownups to do also.

name: Central Dairy
address: 610 Madison St, Jefferson City, MO 65101, USA
reviews: Came here with my troop after visiting the capital building. Everybody enjoyed the ice cream and everyone had a great time. It was a little slow but probaly because we had a lot of people go there. The ice cream is good for the price. They have a large selection of flavors. Would recommend.
Smooth running machine with the crowd. Ice cream is well worth the wait. Friendly service!

Always good and so very many flavors it's hard to choose! Central Dairy ice cream parlor has been in town for as long as I can remember. They are practically a historical establishment. Friendly employees, Booth type seating with some benches outside, and an available bathroom. It is a local favorite and many people come for miles to visit, so be prepared to wait in line during their busy times.
Love this ice cream shop. Best tasting ice cream ever. Get there early for the best variety of selections!

Always packed every time we visit but the employees move the line fast. Husband and I got one "scoop" in a dish each at $2 a scoop. I got Extreme Extreme Moose Tracks, him Tiger Tracks. It's always so good and made in house. They prefer cash, so bring it if you can. Keeps their costs and prices low by avoiding card fees.

name: Big Joel's Safari Petting Zoo & Educational Park
address: 13187 State Hwy M, Wright City, MO 63390, USA
reviews: This is such a fun place. My 2 1/2 year daughter and my 6 year old niece both love this place! They have a lot of different animals and the kids think it’s really cool to feed them. There is a cool little playground area in the middle of the park. Staff was very polite, prices reasonable. Park and the restrooms were both very nice and clean. It’s perfect size for younger kids that can’t run around the bigger zoos all day. Always a good time and worth the drive to check it out!

Their petting zoo was at St. Louis Six Flags for Christmas in the Park. This was hands down one of the best petting zoos I have seen. The animals were clean, healthy, docile and happy! They are well taken care of and would recommend then in a heartbeat.

So much fun! I loved seeing the animals in just some dude's backyard. It made it more special because you know he must REALLY love those animals! Also, it's super fun to feed the animals. Let's not forget that even the fancy St. Louis zoo could not keep their bird feeding aviary open for more than a couple months!
Kiddo loves it and prices are super reasonable. Staff is engaged and friendly. Wish it was closer to home but not their problem lol.
I love the close encounters wt the animals my 9 yr old and my husband and myself had a blast feeding them a fun lil family rd trip

name: St. James Winery
address: 540 State Rte B, St James, MO 65559, USA
reviews:
They have a great selection of Missouri wines and the process are very reasonable. The people are very knowledgeable and can help you find a wine that you would like. They also will let you sample their wines so you can make sure you like what you are planning on purchasing. They offer 28 different varieties on an everyday basis and then they also have seasonal wines that they offer on a limited basis. They also offer tours of the winery as well, which is informative and a fun experience. It is worth the trip and I look forward to coming back for their seasonal offerings. 

Also, they have a wine club that is only quarterly and had a good discount on other purchases as well. You don't have to come to join, you can sign up online, but I recommend coming for the experience and to taste their selection.

Had a wonderful time at the Winery today. I wanted to take my wife here for date night & it did not disappoint. When we first arrived, we were nicely greeted by Sherry. I asked about the tour & Sherry said that she was available to take us on it. She did a great job explaining the history of the winery & their wines. After we were done with the tour, Sherry served as our server and provided us with some great samples that we chose. By the end of the night, we ended up buying 7 bottles & we couldn't be happier. Thank you Sherry for being such a great host. We will definitely come back to the winery when we need more wine.
Always a great stopping place to enjoy wine while on route to Joplin or to St Louis. Lovely store and wine tasting station. Restful and enjoyable...try it!
Beautiful and professional atmosphere with a friendly staff ready to help. Wine tasting before you buy. Lots of other homemade and local products to buy.

To me St. James makes the best wines anywhere. I love a sweet wine and they have it perfected. We lived in California were I found it very difficult to find a sweet wine anywhere.  We also lived in Virginia were they make some pretty good sweet wines. St. James has mastered the art of sweet wine making. I also suggest joining their wine club to get great discounts on wine shipped directly to my home.

name: Jolly Mon Indoor Water Park
address: 480 Tan Tara Estate, Osage Beach, MO 65065, USA
reviews: Best inside water park! Has everything you dreamed of! Not expensive either!

This place was fun! BUT so overpriced! For 4 people not staying in a hotel it costs 100 dollars. There was a hot tub, play thing for the kids, a small lazy river, 2 slides, a concession stand, and a VERY small pool with some baskets. I just feel like there needs to be more things to do. Maybe some more slides, baby pool for the toddlers, floaty rental, etc. I just wish I could have had more fun there. But some positivity in the review, the 2 water slides were very fun. 1 body slide and 1 raft slide. And another thing... if you want to watch your child and not swim or participate, you have to pay $5! Very disappointed with the results of today but, I gave 2 stars because of the slides and a few fun times and memories I had at the beginning.
Loved this place

$17 for hotel guests to swim, $5 for observers.  Cafe on site.  No lifeguards on duty for the lazy river which gets kind of chaotic with people jumping and running in the river area.   Water slides are great.

My grown daughter fell the second day we were there, the area where she fell was terrible slick.  I told the manager, who wasn't old enough to manage that responsibility she had fallen.  He never asked if she needed medical care or that he was even concerned that she fell!  The fall broke both knees open, no bandaids were offered, she could no longer swim due to an open wound.  The Kid Manager didn't care!  We won't be back!

name: Meramec State Park
address: 115 Meramec Park Drive, Sullivan, MO 63080, USA
reviews:
Another treasure in Missouri.
This park offers canoeing, caving, hiking and camping.
The cabins looked nice and cozy.
There are plenty of picnic areas, as well.
You will not be disappointed.

We were just about the only ones staying in the cabin area of the park.  So quiet and peaceful. Very relaxing.  Excellent hiking trails. Cabin was great.  Even got to keep our dog in the cabin. Ready to go back again.

Beautiful state park! There was more to do than what locals made it seem to be. Most of the caves are closed to help support the local bat population. The rest are only open for March to October, which was kind of crummy since it was such a beautiful November weekend.

So open and beautiful! The river was right there so lots of river fun. The deer could care less that you are there so animal watching was amazing. I'm glad my friend and I went in the middle of the week because i can see it getting crowded on weekends
Canoe trip 5 miles down the Meramec river. Wonder filles day. Has the best time,  hadn't floated in over 40 years!

name: TitleMax Title Secured Loans
address: 1001 Missouri Blvd, Jefferson City, MO 65109, USA
reviews: DO NOT UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES USE TITLE MAX. If you get behind in your payments they WILL TAKE YOUR CAR. I was in constant contact with them and had a date set to get my account current. I was finally getting caught up. The night before the date we had agreed on they took my car. I contacted them the next to to get my car and they wanted double what I owed to get my car back. I was $280 behind and they wanted an additional $400 for an unnecessary tow. I had been in their office 3 days before to verify the day I was coming in to get caught up and to offer to leave the car there if neccessary. The company that took my car will not respond to my messages and will not return my personal property. Including my house key, my work keys, my license plates and a bunch of personal papers including my bank info and birth certificate. They prey on the desperate and will not work with you if you get behind.
Hey I Just Got My Title Handled Perfect By The Best New Employer Richard. Thank You So Much For Being A First Timer You Where Awesome. Hope To Do Buisness With You In The Future
Did a great job! Explained everything good!

TitleMax on Missouri Blvd in Jefferson City MO is GREAT!!!! They only have one major issue......they go through too many store managers!!!! Mari is the bomb!!! Amazing customer service the best best personality EVER why are they not promoting her?????? She has been for for the 3 years I’ve been going!!! She’s obviously staying unlike the rest!!! Come Titlemax get it together it’s frustating sitting there watching your new managers constantly struggle and Mari always having to help her “superiors” because they don’t have a clue!!! Promote her already!!!!! Love you Mari!!!!
Jay was great. Helped me out when needed. Highly recommended. Go see him.

name: Big Surf Waterpark
address: 954 State Highway Y, Linn Creek, MO 65052, USA
reviews: Fun water park, decent concessions. The staff was friendly and safe. The children’s pool and activities are amazing, kids are sure to have a blast. Even a few good water slides for the adults to have some fun in the sun.
We love this place. I have literally been taking my sons here for 20+ years. They keep it looking fresh.

A small but well run water park, Big Surf continues to have one of the best wave pools within two hours of central Missouri. Though it's rides tend to be a little more relaxed / smaller than the larger parks, the lines tend to be shorter and go quickly, the food options are good for a small park, and the food prices tend to be a bit more reasonable. 
There are five main slides, with one being fairly intense / a sharp drop at the beginning, ranging to more mild slides (not including a lazy river). Three of the main slides don't need a tube and three do. 
The Space Bowl is probably the best non-inner tube ride, though it's easy to get stuck at the beginning due to the initial lack of incline. The last drop / space bowl portion is the fun part.
The cliff-like tube ride (I forgot the formal name, some call it "the banana") is definitely the most intense ride in the park, with a steep drop of about three stories.
Worth making a day out of with friends, family, or a youth group. Been twice. Good experience both times now.

Overall, the park was great. The kids had fun. Cabanas are nice but don't offer any real privacy.  Food was overpriced and mediocre, but honestly, the kids loved it.  I just wish there was a few adult options.  

Park and water was clean. Staff were super courteous and helpful.  Going back in a few weeks. Totally a hit.
Always a pleasure to visit. This is the only water park that has staff to enforce the rules, which make it a pleasure to visit each year.

name: Six Flags St. Louis
address: 4900 Six Flags Rd, Eureka, MO 63025, USA
reviews: First time going here and had a pretty fun experience. Hall of Justice is such a well done ride and my friends and I had so much fun. Pandemonium was a great ride, along with Mine Train. The ice cream is severed in such big portions that my friend and I had to share. Great place to hang out!

I just stayed at the hotel and I was amazing. the only reason I give it 4 stars is on the toilet there were pee stances on the part for sitting. and I think that the bathroom of a hotel is what needs to be the cleanest. Just my opinion.

Amazing fun for anyone. Great food galore, but can be fairly pricey if you don't have a dining pass. Kind employees, as well as many very charming ones who play characters in events. Many shops filled with touristy things from snow globes to postcards. All rides are extremely fun, but lines can be extremely long depending on what day you come, with Saturdays being extreme in warmer weather. If you come during the summer, the water park is also extremely fun with really fun rides. Tickets aren't too cheap, but you can buy a season pass for not too much more than a ticket. If you plan on going more than twice a year, you should buy a season pass or membership; otherwise, you're good to just go for a ticket. Along with the season pass, the dining pass is a must have. The website goes into better details on the different versions.

This is a very nice facility.  Most of the staff is friendly, and there are a wide variety of things to do around the park.  I just wish there was more shade for when there was hot days but it's not a big concern considering you can just walk in to many of the different places that you can eat.  Speaking of the eateries the food is good everywhere that I have went to eat.  Overall, it is always a fun experience.
Great park. Good rides. Water park is decent. The workers are very friendly every time I visit. Memberships are cheap with great benefits. Season passes can be very cheap when you catch a sale.

name: Gracie Barra Jefferson City Brazilian Jiu Jitsu & Self Defense
address: 1850 State Hwy C Suite A, Jefferson City, MO 65109, USA
reviews: I've been training at Gracie Barra in O'Fallon, Missouri for over a year now and decided to drop in unannounced to the Jefferson City location. So my review is based on my experience for the one class. There were about 10 people total including myself that showed up for the noon class. So it wasn't overly crowded and i was welcomed right away by all the students. Everyone i met treated me like family! I was really impressed with Coach Kirsten and how detail oriented her instruction was.. She really knows her Jiu Jitsu! The gym itself has a nice lay out, none of the equipment was torn up, the mats felt brand new! A very clean facility and very professional! I plan to train here again, next time I'm in the area!

Gracie Barra Jefferson City is the place to go if you’re looking for a family friendly environment and high level BJJ instructors. Drop by for a free trial class and I’m sure you will fall in love for the gentle art. Amazing self defense program for women’s and anti-bullying for kids.

As a former wrestler from MANY years ago, I’ve missed the brotherhood and family of working hard together to get better on and off the mats. This place more than fills that void. This is my home away from home, and these people are my family.
