name: Big Whiskey's American Restaurant & Bar - Jefferson City
address: 627 W McCarty St #1a, Jefferson City, MO 65101, USA
reviews:
I was hoping for a bit more from Big Whiskey. There wasn't anything wrong with it, but there certainly wasn't anything to get excited about either. It seems to be pretty popular as the wait was around 45 minutes and it took a while to get our meals, but the food didn't deliver for what I was expecting. 

I got the turkey burger and it was pretty boring. Others I've had that have been much better have used some pepper jack, Cajun spices, or guacamole to give it some life, but that definitely  wasn't the case here. 

My daughter's mini shrimp were pretty decent. My other daughter got pasta with alfredo, but the noodles were drowned in sauce and she didn't like it much. My wife seemed to like her salmon pretty well.

I'll give it another shot and try something different, but I'll temper my expectations next time.

We (2 couples) had a good time at Big Whiskeys this past weekend during their Grand Opening. The FOOD and DRINKS were GREAT‼😊 They have a huge drink menu, they were running a special on $5 margaritas, which were very good! Their Whiskey Flights are an awesome way to try out several types of whiskey without spending a fortune. The men both tried the Bourbon Flight, it was a pretty cool presentation, picture attached.  Our waitress was very attentive,  even while they were extremely busy. The manager even visited our table to see how everything was and we told him it was great and how much we liked the place.

For those of you with families wondering about taking the kiddos, they are family friendly, they have TV screens everywhere, the KIDS have their own menu and they even eat FREE on TUESDAY NIGHT'S❗  

My friend and I went to the restroom as we were leaving and we were quite surprised. It was very CLEAN, even at midnight, especially after a very busy night. The only suggestion I have on this whole review, is for them to move the paper towel dispenser to the wall by the door. It is just a little awkward where its positioned right now.

I like reading reviews, but I very rarely write one. Since Big Whiskey's is new in town, I felt a review was very important, whether it was GOOD😀 or bad, just to let other people know. We felt that everything went very smoothly Saturday night and we think Big Whiskey's will be a HUGE HIT in Jefferson City, MO.💕

PS. For those late-night people out there, they're open from 12- 2 a.m.

Absolutely the most welcoming experience during such trying times. Restauranat was limited to no more than 10 people, yet they let us wait with drinks in hand for available seating. We’d been driving for 450 miles so what a relief. 
Steak was perfect IPA awesome, service super friendly. 
Thank you for your hospitality!
Dwight

Really good food. Staff was friendly. Our server was there any time we needed something but wasn't hovering which is nice. The food was tasty. I had the nachos (it's labeled as an appetizer) and a brownie for desert. To be honest I didn't need the brownie because I was stuffed from the nachos. Thankfully when you get the brownie you can request more spoons so you can share! Overall a good experience and no one left hungry. It's a little on the pricey side and if I were a cook there I would season more while I'm cooking but like I said overall it was a win in my book.

I only gave a 4 because the food was pretty good but not exceptional. Our service was great, though! They don't do reservations but they do offer "call ahead seating" which basically puts you in a queue and they text you when your table is ready, which worked well for us. Fun place overall and definitely would recommend/return.

name: The Tigers Den
address: 719 Jefferson St, Jefferson City, MO 65109, USA
reviews: The pizza was good. The nachos were nothing special. The place seemed overpriced for the food they serve.
Clean space, nice music and great food!  Our order came out in a very timely manner and the food was seasoned to perfection.  The owner was very friendly and welcoming.  My family and I will be back.
Its ok cost alot for the amount of food u get enough to keep orderingsmall amounts for money but its ok
Pretty good food. Great staff
Best Jamaican food in town

name: Dairy Queen Grill & Chill
address: 2114 Missouri Blvd, Jefferson City, MO 65109, USA
reviews: My niece and I had chili dogs, onion rings and  chocolate milk shakes...the food was warm and delicious. The lady who took our order and brought our food was welcoming and warm like a country restaurant. I wish that I got her name, she totally deserves recognition! She is definitely a keeper!
Use the App. Great deals.

I asked twice for a breaded chicken ranch sandwich I didn't want the grilled chicken he said yes they had it I was waiting in line out in the lobby area and they bring me my food. not on a tray and not in a bag I just bring me the two sandwiches I ordered one of them being wrong there's a grilled chicken instead of breaded chicken and not even a to-go bag there are a bunch of kids just playing in there basically I understand it's Friday night and kids get worked up and and get a bunch of them together but somebody needs to get a grip on that crew for real. The cooks we're talking about it being a Japanese fish sandwich whatever that meant just very unprofessional
Great ice cream, of course. It is a lot pricier than it used to be, but the food is still good!

I was not pleased with the drive-through service about 4pm yesterday.  The person taking and giving the order seemed to care less.  The food was just shoved out the window without the server saying one word to me.  I got home the fries were cold from being not cooked properly and the burger was old.

name: Texas Roadhouse
address: 3104 S Ten Mile Dr, Jefferson City, MO 65109, USA
reviews: We had great service and great food! Our hostess was talking to us all the way to our seat, and was so friendly! Then we met our waiter, Will, who was SO enthusiastic and friendly! Even though it was 2 pm on a Saturday it was very busy, but Will was constantly coming by our table to ask how everything was, and to clear plates! I told my daughter that he should do commercials for the restaurant, because he was so knowledgeable about each and every item on the menu! Great service = a great tip! We’ll definitely be back!

Surprisingly good!

I really enjoyed the prime rib.

Great sides. 

Delicious free dinner rolls and bucket of peanuts.

Friendly service. 

Comfortable seating and pleasant atmosphere. 

Can accommodate large groups. 

Generous size waiting area. 

There’s also a bar.

Convenient location. 

Plenty of parking.

I have heard wait times can be more than a little on the long side. When I arrived the waiting area was packed. As a party of two the hostess suggested we try the bar if we didn't want to wait for a table.
We were seated at the bar and greeted by Jess who has such a warm and bubbly personality she either really loves her job or may need professional help.
Drinks were prompt and proper. She provided options most other bar tenders don't consider. Refills were spot on. Our bread was delivered quickly, the following courses were delivered exactly when needed.
I had the Road Kill. The only thing I can say about this dish is that if it was any more tender I would have needed a spoon.
Until today I thought Ruby Tuesday had the best steak in town. Sorry Ruby's, your steaks are great but despite the valiant effort you have been dethroned.
Judging by the others seated around me my experience was not unique. Several steaks were ordered. One gentleman remarked that his baked potato was the best he had ever had.
At the end of my meal I was stuffed to the point I thought a crane would be required to remove me.
Pricing is comparable to other steak houses in the area.
My advice to make the experience better would be to lower the volume in the restaurant 20% and open for lunch on weekdays. Otherwise, bravo.
Now, if you will excuse me I need a nap.

First, we had the best server I have ever had anywhere, hands down, Will.  He was very friendly and checked on us just the right amount of times.  This man deserves a raise/promotion.  The food was really good.  The music was a little loud to talk (we had a large group) but we dealt with that.  William received a large tip for his awesome service.....Texas Roadhouse, you better keep this one on staff.)

Great atmosphere, awesome service and fantastic food. I will advise to get there as soon as the doors open (4pm) Monday through Friday (11am) Saturday and Sunday as the place fills up fast but well worth the money and wait. Our server was extremely friendly as was everyone else who worked there, we were greeted by every employee we came in contact with on our way to be seated and also everyone said bye and gave a good night on our way out. It was an awesome place to have a family dinner

name: New China
address: 905 Eastland Dr, Jefferson City, MO 65101, USA
reviews: The food here is remarkably good, and the lunch specials are very cheap: a big portion of main dish, fried rice, and an egg roll for under $6. I really like the Orange Chicken, and always get the fried rice St. Louis style (just ask, no extra charge). The buffet is good too for its relatively small size. Be prepared for a really odd mix of music they play... it run the gamut from heavy metal to Enya. 🙄

Food has a funky aftertaste, food overcooked, barely a selection. This would not pass as a 4 star restaurant anywhere and as a visitor to this city I am sorely disappointed in what passes for a 4 star. This place is a 2 star at best. The food is awful, and there's absolutely no service . 10/10 don't recommend, don't waste your time or money. Better off going to Subway, at least you might be happy with the results.

My fiancé and I decided to eat here on a whim. As soon as we walked in, the atmosphere was really cold and dark. The cashier was extremely rude and impatient and acted as if he didn't want to be there. Not a good first impression. Then we walked into what looked like a banquet hall with booth seats just smushed together all over it with horrendous lighting... instead we opted for one of the smaller tables by the buffet. The food wasn't awful but it wasn't fantastic either. We both ordered the sesame chicken combo with crab rangoons. Not bad, but you could tell that it wasn't cooked with care. We probably won't be going back.
Food was not impressive at all. Will not return

Cold food, told this was all they were making at 12:37, rude cashier, small amounts of food to choose from, dirty floors, dirty tables, bathroom is very Grimmie and not enough for a $11.00 buffet for lunch??? I don't think l will be back!?
